org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction

Class ThreadContextTransactionManager.AmbientThreadedTransactionScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase
      • org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.AmbientThreadedTransactionScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, TransactionScope
    Enclosing class:
    ThreadContextTransactionManager

    protected class ThreadContextTransactionManager.AmbientThreadedTransactionScope
extends ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase
    A Transaction that is meant to exist within the context of one thread. There should be no cross-thread transactional data access, only cross-thread state querying.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.xflatdb.xflat.transaction.ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase

    • Method Detail

      • commit

        public void commit()
            throws TransactionException
        Description copied from interface: TransactionScope
        Commits the transaction immediately. Transactions are committed atomically and durably, so that the instant this method returns successfully, the caller can be assured that the modifications performed by this transaction have been saved to disk.
        Throws:
        TransactionException - if an error occurred during the commit. The transaction manager will automatically revert the transaction upon a commit error.
        IllegalTransactionStateException - if the transaction has already been committed, reverted, or is revert only.

      • revert

        public void revert()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionScope
        Reverts the transaction immediately. When a transaction is reverted, the database acts as though all the modifications performed inside the transaction scope never happened.

      • doRevert

        public void doRevert()

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: TransactionScope
        Closes the current transaction scope. If the transaction has yet to be committed or reverted, and the transaction is the last participant in the ambient transaction scope (i.e. the root scope), the entire transaction is reverted immediately.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface TransactionScope
        Overrides:
        close in class ThreadContextTransactionManager.TransactionBase
